name: Trigger
description: The Trigger CHOP starts an audio-style attack/decay/sustain/release (ADSR) envelope to all trigger pulses in the input channels. A trigger point occurs whenever the first input's channel increases across the trigger threshold value. Most commonly, an ADSR starts when the input goes from 0 to 1.
summary: The Trigger CHOP starts an audio-style attack/decay/sustain/release (ADSR) envelope to all trigger pulses in the input channels. A trigger point occurs whenever the first input's channel increases acr

parameters.name: Release = Trigger Threshold
parameters.label: Release = Trigger Threshold
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The Trigger  starts an audio-style attack/decay/sustain/release (ADSR) envelope to all trigger pulses in the input channels. A trigger point occurs whenever the first input's channel increases across the trigger threshold value. Most commonly, an ADSR starts when the input goes from 0 to 1.		
Note: To get a channel with the full waveform, turn off the  parameter on the Common page, and don't connect an input. 
The envelope consists of six major sections: delay, attack, peak, decay, sustain and release.			
From the time the threshold is reached and while the channel's value is above the release threshold, the envelope is in its sustain phase during which it will delay, attack, peak-hold, decay and then maintain its sustain value.			
After the inputs drops below the release threshold, the envelope start its release phase and will drop to 0.			
The peak and sustain levels can be set independently, but peak value can never be less than sustain.							
This  works with both time-sliced inputs or with static input channels.
For jittery inputs, if you don't want it to trigger until its input has been On for some period, see the OP Snippets for the Trigger , example "trigger after a time threshold", which uses the Count .
Note: See examples in OP .			
See also: Timer CHOP, Count CHOP, Speed CHOP, Event CHOP
triggerCHOP_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  threshold - If on, the trigger and release thresholds are the same value.


		
  threshup - The trigger threshold (see above).


		
  threshdown - The release threshold (see above).


		
  retrigger - The amount of time after a trigger point that a new trigger may occur.


		
  retriggerunit - 


		
  mintrigger - The minimum amount of time that the trigger will remain active.


		
  mintriggerunit - 


		
  triggeron -  - Determines whether a trigger occurs on an increasing slope or decreasing slope when passing the trigger threshold. A release will occur on the opposite slope.

 increase - decrease -

  multitrigger -  - 

 ignore - add - restart -

  clamppeak - Clamp the additive effect of Multi-Triggers Additive at the level set in Peak Level parameter.



  triggerpulse - Instantly trigger an envelope (regardless of input).



  updateonce - 


			
  complete - If on, a complete envelope is produced for each trigger point. If off, the envelope may be terminated at any time by a release point.


		
  remainder -  - See Remainder Options. What to do with remaining samples at end of the interval:

 crop - Output interval = input interval. extend - Output longer if envelope unfinished. mix - Add remainder to samples at the start.



  delay - The amount of time to delay the envelope after the trigger point.


		
  delayunit - 


		
  attack - The amount of rise time from zero to the peak level.


		
  attackunit - 


		
  ashape -  - The shape of the attack ramp.

 linear - easein - easeout - halfcos -
		
  peak - The peak level it will rise to in the attack phase.


		
  peaklen - The length of time of the peak is held before going into the decay phase.


		
  peaklenunit - 





  decay - The amount of decay time from the peak level to the sustain level.


		
  decayunit - 


		
  dshape -  - The shape of the decay ramp.

 linear - easein - easeout - halfcos -
		
  sustain - The sustain level. This level is held until a release point is reached (the input goes below the threshold).


		
  minsustain - 


		
  minsustainunit - 


		
  release - The amount of release time from the sustain level to zero.


		
  releaseunit - 


		
  rshape -  - The shape of the release ramp.

 linear - easein - easeout - halfcos -



  channame - Name of channels output.


		
  specifyrate - Allows you to specify the sample rate in the  parameter below.


		
  rate - Sets the sample rate of the output. Only used when  is turned on.





  timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.



  scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page. See Pattern Matching.



  srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

  exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

  autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.



  exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).





 -

Extra Information for the Trigger  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.



 - Start of the  interval in samples. - Number of samples in the . - The samplerate of the channels in frames per second. - Number of channels in the . - 1 if  is  enabled, 0 otherwise. - A count of how often the export connections have been updated.
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\nwikieditorwikieditorwikieditorwikieditorwikieditor2021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
CHOPs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



A Time Slice is the time from the last cook frame to the current cook frame. In CHOPs it is the set of short channels that contain the CHOP channels' samples between the last and the current cook frame.



OP Snippets  is a set of 700+ live examples of TouchDesigner operators. You can access snippets via the Help menu, or by right-clicking on network operators, or r-clicking on OP Create dialog items.



To "pulse" a parameter is to send it a signal from (1) an exported CHOP channel or (2) a python command or (3) a mouse click that causes a new action to occur immediately. A pulse via python is via the .pulse() function on a pulse-type parameter, such as Reset parameter in a Speed CHOP. A pulse from a CHOP is typically a 0 to 1 to 0 signal in an exported channel.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



A parameter in most CHOPs that restricts which channels of that CHOP will be affected. Normally all channels of a CHOP are affected by the operator. TOPs have Channel Mask, a similar feature.



Exporting is the connection of CHOP channels to parameters of operators. The output of each exporting CHOP is one or more channels, active only while the CHOP Viewer is on. The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Trigger_CHOP&oldid=31078"
		Category: CHOPs

This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Trigger_CHOP&oldid=31078"

parameters.name: Release = Trigger Threshold
parameters.label: Release = Trigger Threshold
parameters.description: threshold - If on, the trigger and release thresholds are the same value.

parameters.name: Trigger Threshold
parameters.label: Trigger Threshold
parameters.description: threshup - The trigger threshold (see above).

parameters.name: Release Threshold
parameters.label: Release Threshold
parameters.description: threshdown - The release threshold (see above).

parameters.name: Re-Trigger Delay
parameters.label: Re-Trigger Delay
parameters.description: retrigger - The amount of time after a trigger point that a new trigger may occur.

parameters.name: Re-Trigger Delay Unit
parameters.label: Re-Trigger Delay Unit
parameters.description: retriggerunit -

parameters.name: Min Trigger Length
parameters.label: Min Trigger Length
parameters.description: mintrigger - The minimum amount of time that the trigger will remain active.

parameters.name: Min Trigger Length Unit
parameters.label: Min Trigger Length Unit
parameters.description: mintriggerunit -

parameters.name: Trigger On
parameters.label: Trigger On
parameters.description:
triggeron -  - Determines whether a trigger occurs on an increasing slope or decreasing slope when passing the trigger threshold. A release will occur on the opposite slope.

 increase - decrease -

multitrigger -  -

parameters.name: Clamp at Peak Level
parameters.label: Clamp at Peak Level
parameters.description: clamppeak - Clamp the additive effect of Multi-Triggers Additive at the level set in Peak Level parameter.

parameters.name: Trigger Pulse
parameters.label: Trigger Pulse
parameters.description: triggerpulse - Instantly trigger an envelope (regardless of input).

parameters.name: Update Once per Cycle
parameters.label: Update Once per Cycle
parameters.description: updateonce -

parameters.name: Complete Envelope
parameters.label: Complete Envelope
parameters.description: complete - If on, a complete envelope is produced for each trigger point. If off, the envelope may be terminated at any time by a release point.

parameters.name: Remainder
parameters.label: Remainder
parameters.description:
remainder -  - See Remainder Options. What to do with remaining samples at end of the interval:

 crop - Output interval = input interval. extend - Output longer if envelope unfinished. mix - Add remainder to samples at the start.

parameters.name: Discard Remainder
parameters.label: Discard Remainder
parameters.description: crop - Output interval = input interval. extend - Output longer if envelope unfinished. mix - Add remainder to samples at the start.

parameters.name: Delay Length
parameters.label: Delay Length
parameters.description: delay - The amount of time to delay the envelope after the trigger point.

parameters.name: Delay Length Unit
parameters.label: Delay Length Unit
parameters.description: delayunit -

parameters.name: Attack Length
parameters.label: Attack Length
parameters.description: attack - The amount of rise time from zero to the peak level.

parameters.name: Attack Length Unit
parameters.label: Attack Length Unit
parameters.description: attackunit -

parameters.name: Attack Shape
parameters.label: Attack Shape
parameters.description:
ashape -  - The shape of the attack ramp.

parameters.description: linear - easein - easeout - halfcos -

parameters.description: peak - The peak level it will rise to in the attack phase.

parameters.description: peaklen - The length of time of the peak is held before going into the decay phase.

dshape -  - The shape of the decay ramp.

parameters.name: Channel Name
parameters.label: Channel Name
parameters.description: channame - Name of channels output.

parameters.name: Specify Rate
parameters.label: Specify Rate
parameters.description: specifyrate - Allows you to specify the sample rate in the  parameter below.

parameters.name: Sample Rate
parameters.label: Sample Rate
parameters.description: rate - Sets the sample rate of the output. Only used when  is turned on.

parameters.name: Time Slice
parameters.label: Time Slice
parameters.description: timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.

parameters.name: Scope
parameters.label: Scope
parameters.description: scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page. See Pattern Matching.

parameters.name: Sample Rate Match
parameters.label: Sample Rate Match
parameters.description:
srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.label: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.description: first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Export Method
parameters.label: Export Method
parameters.description:
exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: DAT Table by Index
parameters.label: DAT Table by Index
parameters.description: datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: Export Root
parameters.label: Export Root
parameters.description: autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.

parameters.name: Export Table
parameters.label: Export Table
parameters.description: exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).
